io.github.joblo2213.sma.speedwire

Interface SpeedwireErrorHandler


  • public interface SpeedwireErrorHandler

    The callback that is run on any occurring exceptions while reading incoming packets from sma speedwire.


    If you want to listen for specific types of exceptions, check the type with instanceof.


    Likely exceptions are:
    InvalidTelegramException - if an incoming packet can't be parsed as valid speedwire telegram IOException – if an I/O error occurs.
    PortUnreachableException – may be thrown if the socket is connected to a currently unreachable destination. Note, there is no guarantee that the exception will be thrown.
    IllegalBlockingModeException – if the socket has an associated channel, and the channel is in non-blocking mode.


    Example: 

    
 speedwire.onError(e -> {
    if (e instanceof IOException) {
        //io error
        // ...
    } else if (e instanceof InvalidTelegramException) {
        //packet parsing error
        // ...
    }
 });

      method called upon any exception while receiving or parsing data
